DataElement.preferredName: Bone Scan Tracer New Anatomic Site Uptake Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for information related to tracer uptake in a new anatomic site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Scan Tracer New Anatomic Site Uptake
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to tracer uptake in a new anatomic site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism. :An easily detectable molecule attached to a usually larger molecule.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

A substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:Named locations of or within the body.:The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
Named locations of or within the body.
The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
